concise_definition: v. 失去, 输掉, 丢失, 衰弱

definitions.explanation_en: To no longer have or possess something, often due to misplacement, theft, or accident.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因遗失、被盗或意外而不再拥有某物。
definitions.example_en: She loses her keys every time she goes to the gym.
definitions.example_cn: 她每次去健身房都会丢钥匙。

definitions.explanation_en: To be defeated in a game, competition, or contest.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在游戏、比赛或竞争中被击败。
definitions.example_en: Our team loses every match against their rivals.
definitions.example_cn: 我们的球队每次对阵对手都会输。

definitions.explanation_en: To fail to keep or maintain something valuable, such as time, opportunity, or health.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指未能保持或维持某种宝贵的事物，如时间、机会或健康。
definitions.example_en: He loses focus easily during long meetings.
definitions.example_cn: 他在长时间会议中很容易分心。

definitions.explanation_en: To gradually diminish in strength, quality, or quantity; to decline.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指逐渐减弱、质量下降或数量减少；衰退。
definitions.example_en: The patient loses weight rapidly after the surgery.
definitions.example_cn: 病人手术后体重迅速下降。

comparison.analysis: “Miss” (错过) 通常指未能抓住、到达或体验某事物，常带有遗憾或偶然性，如错过班车或机会。而 “loses” 更强调因自身疏忽、失败或外部因素导致的永久性或实质性丧失，如失去财产或比赛。
“Waste” (浪费) 指不必要地消耗或滥用资源，强调行为的愚蠢或低效。而 “loses” 是结果导向的，不必然包含主观过错，例如“lose a game”是结果，不等于“waste a game”。
“Decline” (衰退) 更正式，常用于描述趋势性的、缓慢的下降，如人口减少或经济下滑，多用于宏观语境。而 “loses” 更通用，可用于具体事物（如钥匙、比赛）的即时性丧失，语义更直接、口语化。
